reason.tex: %text To verify whether if a set of three points $\ora{A}$, $\ora{B}$ and $\ora{C}$, are colinear, check that their pairwise displacement vectors are scalar multiples of each other. That is $\ora{AB}=k\ora{BC}$, where $k$ is a scalar. % \begin{align} (\vector{3}{2}{})-(\vector{-1}{1}{})&=\vector{4}{-5}{} \\ (\vector{-1}{1}{})-(\vector{-5}{12}{})&=\vector{8}{-11}{} \end{align}\\ %text The displacement vectors $\vector{4}{-5}{}$ and $\vector{8}{-11}{}$ are not scalar multiples of each other and therefore not in the same direction. Hence the points are not colinear. %
